EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION POLICIES

Seal Beach Gas Processing Joint Venture has a long standing commitment to worker and public safety. This commitment is demonstrated by the resources invested in accident prevention, such as personnel training and consideration of safety in the design, operation, and maintenance of the Gas Processing System.  Seal Beach Gas Processing Joint Venture's policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substance.



STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE

The facility utilizes the Gas Processing System to process natural gas that is supplied from the field.  Process Safety Information Attachment C contains the inventory calculations for each system.  

Risk Considerations

Although the storage and processing of flammables has inherent potential risks, and worst-case release scenarios can potentially reach the community; Seal Beach Gas Processing Joint Venture has recognized these potential risks and structured its safety programs to make the worst-case type of event non-credible.  In addition to the safety practices of the company and facility personnel to make this worst-case event non-credible, it should also be recognized that there are inherent analysis assumptions that make the results of the atmospheric dispersion analysis appear worse than what would actually be expected during such an event.  In addition to the use of conservative analysis assumptions that over-predict the effects of a potential release, other characteristics of the facility and site serve to minimize the potential risks associated with a flammable release:

-There are process valves to permit isolation of any leaks in place.

-The system undergoes scheduled maintenance to reduce the likelihood of catastrophic failures.

-Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) is used by facility personnel, as necessary.

-A well designed relief system to flare

FLAMMABLES: WORST CASE

Scenario Description: Per the CalARP Regulations, one worst-case analysis has been defined for the process.  The results can be found in the Hazard Assessment documentation located in the CalARP Compliance Workbook.



FLAMMABLES: ALTERNATIVE RELEASE

Scenario Description: A realistic alternative release scenario was defined for the process.  The results can be found in the Hazard Assessment documentation located in the CalARP Compliance Workbook.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM 

Seal Beach Gas Processing Joint Venture has implemented an Emergency Action Plan and does not assume the role of first responder during an emergency. Seal Beach Gas Processing Joint Venture has filed a Hazardous Materials Business Plan with the Orange County Fire Authority and this plan includes:

- Emergency Alarm Procedures

- Evacuation Procedures

- Safety and Health Considerations

- Notification Procedures



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Seal Beach Gas Processing Joint Venture is extremely diligent in the handling of flammables. Planned changes to improve safety are listed as recommendations in the PHA Report which can be found behind the PHA Tab in the CalARP Compliance Workbook.
